item.title: Demo
item.description: Usage uniq2 [OPTIONS] [INPUT [OUTPUT]] OPTIONS -a, --adjacent delete only adjacent duplicated lines. -d, --delete-lines only prints deleted lines. -i, --ignore-case case sensitive. -h, --help print this message. INPUT gives file name of input. If argument is single dash ('-') or absent, the program read strings from stdin. OUTPUT represents the destination. Demo $ cat -n testdata/test1.txt 1 a1 2 a1 # <- is the duplicate of the previous line. 3 a2 4 a2 # <- is the duplicate of the previous line.
